meanings.definition: To remove mist or fog from a surface.
meanings.sent1: I demisted the bathroom mirror after my shower.
meanings.sent2: The car windows quickly demisted once the heater was turned on.
meanings.sent3: The magician demisted the crystal ball to reveal the hidden message.
meanings.sent4: Her smile demisted the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun's warmth demisted the dew-covered grass.

meanings.definition: Having had mist or fog removed.
meanings.sent1: The demisted windshield provided a clear view of the road.
meanings.sent2: The demisted goggles allowed him to see clearly underwater.
meanings.sent3: She felt demisted after a refreshing walk in the crisp morning air.
meanings.sent4: The demisted landscape sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The demisted glasses revealed a stunning mountain view.
